About Me

I was born in Seoul, Korea and grew up in Vancouver, Canada.
I’m now in Providence, Rhode Island, where I study computer science at Brown University.
I’m particularly interested in security and data science.

I’m also into politics, and I help put together Brown Political Review’s magazine.
I hope to end up somewhere I can merge my interests and use technology to promote social good.

In my spare time, you can find me doing a crossword, running, or watching Jeopardy.
I’m always looking for recommendations for books/articles to read and new coffee shops to love!

Over winter break, I’m working on this website and tinkering with MATLAB in preparation for TAing CS4.
See what I’m up to on Github!

For more of me, feel free to check out my LinkedIn and find me lurking on Twitter.
You can also reach me at angiejwkim@gmail.com.

Go back home.

Created by Angie Kim, January 2018.
